# Arpeggio: Minor Major 7th in A# (Shape: C)

An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes in a chord are played in a sequence rather than simultaneously. The Minor Major 7th arpeggio in A# (or Bb) is built based on the third degree of the major scale. In this case, the notes will be C, Eb, G, and B. It combines a minor triad with a major seventh.

## Notes and Intervals
- C (Root)
- Eb (Minor third)
- G (Perfect fifth)
- B (Major seventh)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor Major 7th arpeggio tends to have a sophisticated and dreamy quality. It is often used in jazz, fusion, and some progressive rock contexts, adding a sense of tension and resolution due to the combination of minor and major tonalities. In jazz music, this arpeggio can create a modern and colorful sound when applied to chord progressions.

## Songs
1. **"Giant Steps" by John Coltrane**: This influential jazz composition features complex chord progressions that utilize arpeggios, including the Minor Major 7th arpeggio.
   
2. **"Birdland" by Weather Report**: This jazz fusion classic showcases intricate harmonies where the Minor Major 7th arpeggio can be heard in the solo sections.

3. **"The Sound of Muzak" by Porcupine Tree**: In this progressive rock song, the Minor Major 7th arpeggio is used to create an atmospheric and unpredictable harmonic texture.
